On this page

BitDDD Project Manual ​

Project Overview ​

BitDDD is a documentation site project built with VitePress, mainly used for displaying and managing various documentation content. The project uses a modular design for easy expansion and maintenance.

Project Structure ​

docs/
├── .vitepress/          # VitePress configuration files
├── api-examples.md      # API examples documentation
├── index.md            # Home page
├── markdown-examples.md # Markdown examples
├── random/             # Random posts directory
│   ├── index.md        # Random posts home
│   ├── post1.md        # First post
│   ├── post2.md        # Second post
│   └── manual.md       # This manual
└── ...

Common Operations ​

1. Start Development Server ​

bash
npm install  # Install dependencies
npm run docs:dev  # Start development server

The development server runs on http://localhost:5173 by default.

2. Build Static Files ​

bash
npm run docs:build  # Build production version

Built files are stored in the .vitepress/dist directory.

3. Preview Build Results ​

bash
npm run docs:preview  # Preview built static files

Adding New Documentation ​

1. Create New Page ​

Create a .md file in the appropriate directory, for example:

bash
# Create new document in random directory
touch docs/random/new-post.md

2. Page Frontmatter Configuration ​

Each page can include YAML frontmatter configuration:

yaml
---
title: Page Title
description: Page Description
outline: deep  # Show deep outline
---

3. Update Navigation Menu ​

Edit docs/.vitepress/config.mts to add new navigation items:

typescript
nav: [
  // Other navigation items...
  { text: 'New Menu', link: '/new-path/' },
],

sidebar: [
  // Other sidebar items...
  {
    text: 'New Category',
    items: [
      { text: 'New Page', link: '/new-path/page' }
    ]
  }
]

Markdown Syntax ​

Headings ​

Use # symbol to create headings:

markdown
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3

Text Styles ​

markdown
*Italic*
**Bold**
***Bold Italic***
~~Strikethrough~~
==Highlight==

Lists ​

Ordered list:

markdown
1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

Unordered list:

markdown
- Item one
- Item two
  - Sub item

Code Blocks ​

Inline code: console.log('Hello World')

Code block:

markdown
```javascript
function hello() {
  console.log('Hello World');
}
```

Custom Containers ​

markdown
::: info
This is an info
:::

::: tip
This is a tip
:::

::: warning
This is a warning
:::

::: danger
This is a danger warning
:::

::: details
This is a details block
:::

Project Maintenance ​

Modify Theme Configuration ​

Edit docs/.vitepress/config.mts to modify site title, description, navigation, etc.

Add Custom Styles ​

You can create custom components and styles in the docs/.vitepress/theme directory.

Deployment ​

After building, deploy the files from the .vitepress/dist directory to a static server.

Troubleshooting ​

Local Server Won't Start ​

If startup fails, try:

  1. Clear cache: delete .vitepress/cache directory
  2. Reinstall dependencies: npm install
  3. Use different port: npx vitepress dev docs --port 3000

Note: In production, use actual domain name instead of localhost address.

Build Failure ​

Check for syntax errors, especially if YAML frontmatter format is correct.

Hot Reload Not Working ​

Restarting the development server usually solves the problem.

Version Update ​

When there is a new VitePress version, you can update it with:

bash
npm update vitepress

Then check if the configuration file needs to be adjusted accordingly.
